definition: owner of sth lost or stolen
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)

sentences.english: Because Laoqiang had a little difficulty walking, so we let him wait for us in the same place.
sentences.chinese: 因为失主行走有点儿不便，我们让他在原地等着我们。

sentences.english: I’m trying to find the owner of a wallet I found.
sentences.chinese: 我拣到一个钱包，希望能找到失主。

sentences.english: I caught up with him at last and gave the case back to him.
sentences.chinese: 我终于追上了失主，并把箱子还给他。

sentences.english: The stolen property must be restore to its ower.
sentences.chinese: 盗窃的物品必须要归还失主。

sentences.english: He was able to find the owner because it was a class ring from high school.
sentences.chinese: 他可以找出失主，因为它是一枚高中的班戒。

sentences.english: Also, many electronic devices are locked, making it difficult to determine who owns them.
sentences.chinese: 许多电子产品都是锁着的，为确定失主带来困难。

sentences.english: They found one in every five wallets was handed back.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现有五分之一的钱包被归还给失主。

sentences.english: " finders keepers , losers weepers " can become an ethical question.
sentences.chinese: 拾到失物是否应该归还失主，变成一个道德问题。

sentences.english: OK, it will be easier to find the owner with all this.
sentences.chinese: 好的，有了这些就容易找到失主了。

definition: to pick up money and not hide it (idiom); to return property to its owner
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to claim (as one's property)/to adopt (a child)/to accept (an illegitimate child as one's own)
to report a case to the authorities
to lose sth and then regain it (idiom)
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
(of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
